page.title: 04Conservation in Monks Kirby.
page.content: In the grounds of Brockhurst Middle School there is a piece of land of about two acres which has been set aside as a nature reserve.It has been worked on for about two years but was officially opened on 12th.July 1985 by Colin Potter a local conservation enthusiast. The idea to conserve this area for the school came from a parent, Mrs. Sarah Haine who has been the driving force in the development of the area.We have had help from many organisations the main ones being {W.A.R.N.A.C.T.}and{WATCH.}The ground was naturaly wet and therefore provided a good opportunity to create areas which would be habitable by many small creatures which would in turn attract birds as well as larger animals.
